fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If user profile language is set to Swedish, starting a sprint with Start Date and End Date picked with the date picker will throw an error like Incorrect date format
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Switch user profile language to Dansk
 # Create a new sprint in a project
 # Start the sprint with the start date and end date
 # Edit the dates by clicking a date from the pop-up calendar

h3. Expected Results

With the dates selected from the date picker, the sprint can be started
h3. Actual Results

An error is thrown that the Start Date and End Date are in the wrong format
 !image-2019-11-06-17-53-10-915.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Change the Language to English in the Personal settings page.

Another workaround is to add a "." at the end if the month for april so the format is `4/apr./19` which is the correct format.
fields.summary: Date format error when trying to start sprint while using Dansk

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When I hide the fix version field on Kanban classic all my issues disappear from Kanban board. Even if an issue is not assigned to any fix version.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a classic Kanban project
 # Create a few issues so that they show up in the Kanban board
 # Go to the Jira settings -> Issues -> Field Configuration and scroll down to "Fix version" and click on the "hide" link
 # Go back to the Kanban board and all your issues will disappear from the board

Note that the query for the board has not been modified.

Tested this on my instance: [https://blee.jira-dev.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=59&projectKey=KC]
h3. Expected Results

After hiding the fix version field I expect the issues to still appear in the board.
h3. Actual Results

All the issues disappear from the board - even new issues created will not appear on the board.
h3. Workaround

Even modifying the query of the Kanban board did not help in making the issues appear.
fields.summary: When I hide the fix version field on Kanban classic all my issues disappear from Kanban board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Presently, it is not possible to simply change the project lead of a next-gen project via the user interface.
h3. Expected

Please provide a feature via the UI, the same way as  the Classic project, where users can simply change the Project lead to another user or simply turn the assignment of issues created to unassigned.
h3. Background

Usually, when a next-gen project is created, there's a field called "assigneeType" during creation, this is auto set to "UNASSIGNED". However in some situation, this value can be set to "PROJECT_LEAD". which might cause unwanted assignment to a Project_Lead.
h3. Workaround

Using *cURL*, you can be able to change the Project Lead of a next-gen Project. Please generate an API token [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/api-tokens-938839638.html]
{code:java}
curl --request PUT \
  --url 'https://<your-instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project/{projectId}' \
  --user 'email@address.com:API-TOKEN' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
   "leadAccountId": "5d3b06xxxxxxxxx",
  "projectTypeKey": "software",
  "key": "ABC"
}'
{code}
You will have to run this via a Terminal, enter the details of the new users by using the *accountId*, this can be gotten from https://<your-instance>.atlassian.net/people then search for the user to know the *accountId* which is in an alphanumeric String. Secondly insert the correct project id and project key on the Script prior to running it.
fields.summary: Ability to Change the Project Lead of next-gen project

fields.description:
Would like to move  a Jira software project from one cloud account to other, please help us to do the move with all the dependencies.

As for my observation we see attachments are not moving and work flows are not getting moved automatically, I think you would have access to move all dependencies for us to work smoothly without any downtime. Let me know what all you need to get it moved by your team.
fields.summary: Wants to move a project from one account to other account

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, in the task board, the ranking of the sub-tasks is tied to the parent issue of those sub-tasks.

The following use case is affected by this and can create some confusion.

Assuming we have the following stories and sub-tasks:

* ABC-1
** ABC-10
** ABC-11
** ABC-12
* ABC-2
** ABC-20
* ABC-3
** ABC-31

And assuming we have a board with 3 columns called "To Do", "In Progress", and "Done" with the swimlanes disabled.

If all the stories are in the "To Do" and all the sub-tasks in the "In progress" columns, following the same order, the sub-tasks ABC-20 and ABC-30 cannot be ranked above the sub-task ABC-10.

To change the order of the sub-tasks in the "In progress" column, it's necessary to reorder the parents ABC-1, ABC-2, and ABC-3

h3. Suggested Solution

As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to change the rank of sub-tasks without having the restriction of the parent issue.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want the sub-tasks' rank independent of their parents'rank

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In a next-gen project, if issues have decimal story points (0.5, 1.5) they are displayed as (0,1) respectively.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a next-gen project, create a sprint with story points 0.5, 1.5 added to issues.
# Navigate to Reports > Sprint burndown chart > Set the Estimation field to Story points.
# Report doesn't show the complete decimal story points.

h3. Expected Results
Decimal story points should be shown in the sprint burndown chart

h3. Actual Results
Decimal story points (for example, 0.5, 1.5) are shown as 0 and 1.


h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Burndown chart is next-gen project doesn't display decimal story points

fields.description:
We are requesting your help with an accessibility issue from one of our users that is blind: When he is trying to fill some fields, there is no problem when the field is empty. But when the field has data associated to a link, he has problems because when he clicks, the field (like versions, components and sprint) , that action, opens the content of the link in the field instead of let him choose other option. 

Could you please take this request in account to improve the accessibility of this blind person.
fields.summary: accessibility  issue from blind person

fields.description: In Next-gen project, when grouping by subtasks, the swimlanes should be ordered by issue rank, similar to how they appear in the backlog.
fields.summary: Swimlane order when grouping by Subtasks should match issue rank order

fields.description:
Hi,

We have Jira Software Cloud for Dev team and ASANA for administrative areas.

The guys that are not from IT area says Jira is complicated. The usability is not good.

These areas are using ASANA because it is more simple to use.

Please, create a simplified interface / project template for administrative areas.
fields.summary: Improve usability to used by administrative areas

fields.description:
As of now, the calculation which displays the remaining days for a sprint does not include the start and end date, as well as current working days when you pass the end time for the sprint.
Having the possibility of controlling these calculations can help teams working on different timezones to have a more consistent visualization for the remaining days of the sprint.
fields.summary: Ability to edit the calculation of the remaining days for a sprint

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, only Bitbucket pipelines, crucible and bamboo builds are visible on Jira cloud 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the possibility to view Github actions and other pipeline builds on Jira cloud
fields.summary: Possibility to view Github actions in the development panel

fields.description:
We are using next gen boards without sprints turned on. I have added the due date field to all issues types. However, *you can only see the due date when the specific issue is open.* The due date is also not visible when looking at the issues inside of their Epic.

*We need to be able to see the due date (if present) on the card on the board without opening an issue as this greatly impacts being able to efficiently plan and triage work.*

!image-2019-10-31-07-11-09-972.png!
fields.summary: Want Ability to See Due Date on Next Gen Board

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 31 October 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}

Hi everyone,

This ticket has been opened to track the remaining custom fields that are offered in Classic, that are currently not offered in Next-gen. We will be looking at ways in which we can solve the same problems without having an explosion in custom field types with overlapping functionality. 

Please vote and leave a comment on which fields you are using and need, thanks.

Regards,  
Nathan Sturgess
nsturgess at atlassian dot com 
Product Manager, JIRA Platform

{panel}
fields.summary: Remaining custom fields for Next-gen projects

fields.description: I would like to be able to archive projects in Jira Cloud, which is currently not available.
fields.summary: Archive projects in Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Kanban Backlog ranking does not work when sub-task is on top of the backlog
h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud
 * Kanban Board

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Parent task e.g. Story > Send to the top of the backlog
 # Move the issue into the board > Create a sub-task
 # Sub-task would be listed on the top of the backlog
 # Right-click on an issue and select Top of Backlog

h3. Expected Results
 * The issue is sent to the top

h3. Actual Results
 * The issue is sent to the bottom

h3. Notes
 * Bottom of backlog works well

h3. Workaround

Drag a non-sub-task to the top, ranking starts working
fields.summary: Kanban backlog ranking does not work when sub-task is on top of the backlog

fields.description:
When you split an issue on Backlog, Jira will not add the default value for the new issue created. The value will be kept empty. 

Since it's a default value for a field that is on the Screen, Jira should add this value when splitting an issue.
fields.summary: Split Issues should add default values from custom fields
Ability to see all issue parents directly on jira the card

fields.description:
_This issue was simply a documentation inconsistency. The documentation has now been updated. "state" should be "FUTURE", "ACTIVE" or "CLOSED"._
h3. Issue Summary

Jira ignore the Sprint state in JSON file even though it has been set to "Complete"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Follow the steps as outlined here [Importing data from JSON|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-json-776636779.html/]
 * Set the state of the sprint to "Complete" and make sure there is no existing Sprint with the same name.
{code:java}
          "priority" : "High",
          "description" : "Test JSON import",
          "status" : "DONE",
          "reporter" : "abcde-12345-fedcba",
          "issueType" : "Bug",
          "summary" : "Test JSON import",
          "customFieldValues": [
            {
              "fieldName": "Sprint",
              "fieldType": "com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint",
              "value": [
                {
                  "rapidViewId": 11,
                  "state": "Complete",
                  "name": "SEK Sprint 123"
{code}

 * Import the json file using the *External system import*

h3. Expected Results

Sprint is imported as "Complete Sprint" and not showing in backlog
h3. Actual Results

Sprint is imported as "Future Sprint" and visible in backlog
h3. Workaround

No workaround at this moment
fields.summary: Jira ignores the Sprint state in JSON import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Create a new issue inside the Kanban backlog displayed a wrong message if the user profile is set as Portuguese.
 This issue only happens if the created issue is not part of the board filter, in other words, the issue is created inside the board backlog but the issue won't be displayed inside the board backlog.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the Jira to Portuguese.
 # Create a new Kanban board.
 # Enable the Kanban backlog.
 # Edit the Kanban board filter to only display a specific issue.
 # Create a new issue inside the Kanban backlog.
 # The issue won't be displayed on your board backlog and you will see a wrong error message in Portuguese.

h3. Expected Results

!Screen Shot 2019-10-29 at 13.46.05.png|thumbnail!

Your issue XXX has been created but is not currently visible. (Portuguese version)
h3. Actual Results

!Screen Shot 2019-10-29 at 13.47.14.png|thumbnail!

Seu(s) criado(s), mas no momento.
h3. Workaround

Set Jira to a different Language.
fields.summary: Create a new issue inside the Kanban backlog displayed a wrong message if the user profile is set as Portuguese.

fields.description:
At the company where I work, we have a practice of creating one branch per Jira issue.
In Bitbucket there is a nice feature where you can go to a branch and click the button Checkout in sourcetree. This is really convienient, but one thing that would make this feature even more convienient is if you were able to somehow go to a Jira ticket, select it and checkout in sourcetree. And it would then automatically create a branch via bitbucket if it does not exist and move the ticket to In Progress for the workflow. It would then work the same way that the Checkout in Sourcetree button works where you get a popup in sourcetree. If there are multiple branches, this could still be resolved by allowing to choose which branch should be checked out wiht a popup
fields.summary: Ability to "Checkout in sourcetree" Directly on the Jira card

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Next-gen issue is dragged from Backlog to Sprint section (Classic board), it will stay in Backlog section after page refresh (it only affects for Kanban next-gen project type).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have 2 projects; Classic *Scrum* type and *Kanban* next-gen project type.
 # Create some issues in both projects
 # Create a filter that include both projects
 # Create a new board based on the above filter
 # Go to the above board (Classic project) > Create a Sprint
 # Move some issues from both projects to the Sprint
 # Start the Sprint > Refresh the page

h3. Actual Results

Issues from Kanban next-gen project type are not grouped in Sprint section (they stay in Backlog)
h3. Expected Results

Issues from Kanban next-gen project type are grouped in Sprint section
h3. Notes
 * Those issues from Kanban next-gen project are still shown in Sprint Report
 * Searching in Issue Navigator (Sprint = <Sprint ID>) doesn't return issues from next-gen project
 * Issue history recorded that the issues from Kanban next-gen project are correctly added in the Sprint

h3. Workaround
 * Go to Kanban next-gen project configuration
 ** https://<URL>.atlassian.net/projects/<project key>/settings/features
 * Enable both Backlog and Sprint
 * Disable them again
fields.summary: Next-gen issue is not shown in Sprint section in Classic board

fields.description:
At the moment, the only option to view the boards are from https://<atlassian-url>/secure/ManageRapidViews.jspa

It would be great to have an CSV Export option to retrieve the list from Jira.
fields.summary: Ability to export list of board

fields.description:
Dear Team,

 

I am seeing errors in sentence, please check attached snapshot.

 

 

Thanks

Jameel
fields.summary: Spelling correction  -Issue Links is resolved by

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when configuring columns on a board (Scrum or Kanban), you are only able to map columns to statuses that are in use by the related workflows.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow columns to be configured with a JQL query in addition to the status, as this will allow further customization on which issues are presented in each column.
fields.summary: Allow columns to be configured with JQL filters

fields.description:
Quick filters in board settings are currently applied to both the active sprint as the backlog.

I would like to have separate quick filters on the backlog than for the active sprint as the use cases for filtering on the backlog are usually much different than filtering on the active sprint.
fields.summary: Set different quick filters for backlog and active sprint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is possible to export the roadmap (as an image). You can also define a date range (*Start date* and *End date*).

According to the documentation, the export should respect the date range defined.

But even though an Epic does not match with the date range defined, it will be included in the export.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Have some Epics with *Start date* defined from October, and any *End date* within October as well;
* Have an Epic whose *Start date* and *End date* are ahead of that month (e.g. December);
* Click on *Export* in the top right when viewing the Roadmap;
* Define the *Start date* as October 1st, and the *End date* as October 31st;
* *Export*.

h3. Expected Results

Only the Epics that match with the date range specified will be included in the export.

h3. Actual Results

In that case, the *Epic 4* is included even though it does not match with the date range specified:
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-28 at 11.04.55.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Next-gen roadmap export should allow a way to exclude Epics out of the specified date range

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
could not re-order some epics at the top of the roadmap

h3. Steps to replicate
# Create a Next Gen Board and create multiple Epics within the Roadmap view
# Create a Software classic board and add the Next Gen issues to this board 
# Assign the Next Gen Epic Issue to a sprint from the Classic Board
# Attempt to re-order the Epic with Sprints From the Next Gen project - Roadmap view

h3. Expected Result
Able to re-order Epics

h3. Actual Result
Epics with Sprint sticks to the top

h3. Workaround
Please Contact Support
fields.summary: Roadmap reordering broken

fields.description:
Right now, attempting to select the JIRA ID results in something like this where the text around it is also selected, and it's nigh impossible to select just the JIRA ID:

!image-2019-10-25-16-09-39-709.png!

Please fix the layout so we can just select the JIRA ID without the text around it. Or better yet, please add a button nearby to copy the JIRA ID to the clipboard.
fields.summary: It should be easy to select and copy the JIRA ID, without selecting other text

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is not possible to release in a Kanban board if the field *Fix versions* is hidden.

However, the error message displayed is completely misleading, and will lead users into looking for the wrong configurations when trying to solve the problem.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Hide the field *Fix versions* in the project's field configuration:
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-25 at 13.25.57.png|thumbnail! 
* Try to perform a release in the Kanban board.

h3. Expected Results

You will not be able to release, and an error message will be displayed stating that the field *Fix Versions* is out of context.

h3. Actual Results

You will not be able to release (as expected), but a misleading message stating the following will be displayed:
{noformat}
There are no issues to be released
{noformat}

See the recording:  [^Misleading error.mp4].

Even when inspecting the browser, the message is displayed as that one:
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-25 at 13.40.35.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2019-10-25 at 13.40.42.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: A misleading error message will be displayed when attempting to release while the field Fix Versions is hidden

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a new release version directly fro the Kanban board the current date is automatically populated for the date of the release of the version. However, after committing the release if you review this in the list of released version on the releases page the release date is the day prior to the auto populated one from the Kanban board. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Kanban project and board.
 # Create an issue.
 # Progress this issue to a done status.
 # Click the release button on the Kanban board.
 # Select *New version*.
 # Enter a version name in the pop-up dialogue but leave the populated date (which should be the current date).
 # Click the *Release* button.
 # Now view the list of released versions from the projects releases page.

h3. Expected Results
The release date for the version just release should be the same pre-populated date, that being the current day.

h3. Actual Results
The release date is set to the day prior to the date specified when creating the release from the Kanban board

!Screenshot 2019-10-25 at 14.35.53.png|thumbnail!  
!Screenshot 2019-10-25 at 14.36.13.png|thumbnail! 
!Screenshot 2019-10-25 at 14.36.40.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
# Create the release in the project release page.
# Assign the release to the *Fix version* field of the issues to be incorporated into this release.
# Progress the issue to the done status.
# Click the release button on the Kanban board and select the existing release.
# Populate a release date a click the release button.
#  Review the release in the projects release page

 !Screenshot 2019-10-25 at 14.40.19.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2019-10-25 at 14.40.32.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2019-10-25 at 14.41.13.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2019-10-25 at 14.41.02.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2019-10-25 at 14.41.22.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2019-10-25 at 14.41.29.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2019-10-25 at 14.41.37.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2019-10-25 at 14.41.45.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2019-10-25 at 14.42.00.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Incorrect date in the release page for new releases created directly from Kanban board

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to be able to archive projects that are completed and signed off without losing the project detail. 

It would be fine to be able to collapse the list of projects into an 'Archive' or 'Inactive' list, in the same way as workflows are done now.

The current list of projects is too long an cumbersome to manage.
fields.summary: Ability to archive projects in Jira Cloud

fields.description:
It gets very cluttered very quickly when having several clients with several projects. We already work with the Workaround (implementing a Permission Scheme to archive projects), but this is not sufficient.

 

We need a real solution for this, please.
fields.summary: Archiving Projects in the Cloud Version

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the status of releases are limited to Released, Unreleaseased and Archived

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the functionality to add new status' of release

h3. Why this is important
Customers want to add new status' like: Successful, Successful with issues, Failed Forward, Backed-out
fields.summary: New status of a Release

fields.description:
As a Jira user, when clicking on links in the comments or descriptions of a ticket, it would be great if the link opened in a new browser tab.  This would allow a user to reference the original ticket in one tab and the opened up link/page in another tab.

+*Use Case:*
+When viewing bugs and steps to recreate a bug, once the link is opened in the same tab, a user needs to use the browser back button to navigate back and forth between the ticket (which contains the steps to recreate the bug) and the link/page of the application or website that the link directs to.
fields.summary: Open link in new browser tab

fields.description: We need to be able to group projects in different ways. Having a single category only allows projects to be in a single "group". If Project Category was a multi-select field, we could group projects in many different ways.
fields.summary: Make Project Category multi-select

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On Next-gen boards, if the user sets the Max issues on a column to 0, the configuration will stick until the page is refreshed. After the page is refreshed, the number will be reset, as if it wasn't set to 0 at all. The following video better demonstrates the problem:

 [^JRACLOUD-73252.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
The 0 value of the "Max value" on columns will remain even after a page refresh.

h3. Actual Results
The 0 value of the "Max value" on columns is reset as "no value" after a page refresh.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
Admins can consider working with a classic project for that specific purpose, leveraging the following Knowledge Base:

* [Migrate between next-gen and classic projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/migrate-between-next-gen-and-classic-projects-957974933.html]
fields.summary: On Next-gen boards, the value 0 for Max value on columns does not persists

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When on the Version Report, sometimes we'll notice clipping of the chart data. It won't render predictions up to 100% of the version completion, clipping some of the prediction line.

The line itself and prediction are still correct, but the bounds of the chart aren't.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create and estimate some issues
 # Create a release
 # Add these issues to the release
 # Open a release report and observe the predicted completion date
 # Update your release so that the prediction would be more than 90 days in the future

h3. Expected Results

The chart will render with some padding around its contents.
h3. Actual Results

The chart clips its content depending on the board's non-working days configuration.
h3. Workaround

No known work around at the moment
fields.summary: The Version Report in Classic Projects picks an incorrect maximum X boundary, clipping some data

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The next-neg Burndown chart isn't considering the story points estimation of the issues

h3. Environment

Jira Software cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a next-gen project using the Scrum template
# Add issues to the project
# Add estimation to the issues
# Create a sprint
# Add the issues to the sprint
# Start the sprint
# Access the Burndown chart

h3. Expected Results

The report shows the total story points of the issues at the moment of the sprint start.

h3. Actual Results

The report isn't showing the issues' estimation

 !Screen Shot 2019-10-23 at 1.46.26 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-23 at 1.46.34 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The next-gen Burndown chart isn't considering the story points estimation of the issues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when searching for a list of issues using the issue navigator and then exporting the results to CSV, JIRA won't include the parent-id field and its values
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to export this field as well when using the CSV export functionality.
fields.summary: Allow exporting the 'Parent-ID' field to CSV in Next-gen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41206].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour
Sub-Task does not auto transition when the parent issue transition in a workflow 

h3. Feature Request
Sub-Task should auto transition when the parent issue transition in a workflow and vice versa
fields.summary: Auto transition Sub-Task when the parent issue transitioned in a workflow

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After a user renames a version in the board's backlog, dragging and dropping issues no longer works. Instead, text is selected

h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud, a (classic) Scrum project with some versions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the backlogs section of a board. Open the _Versions_ panel
# On one of the versions, click the down-arrow and then click _Edit name_. Rename the version.
# Attempt to drag&drop an issue either to a version or just to rank it higher

h3. Expected Results
The user can drag&drop issues from the backlog

h3. Actual Results
When attempting to drag&drop, the cursor selects text from the page

h3. Workaround

After renaming the version, refreshing the browser page fixes the issue
fields.summary: After renaming a version, users cannot drag & drop issues

fields.description: Jira next-gen projects allow me to close an epic without closing all child issues, and closing a task without closing all subtasks. This leaves the possibility for errors.
fields.summary: In next-gen projects, prohibit epics/tasks from being closed without tasks/subtasks being closed first.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Assign the issue to epic
 # Drag into sprint
 # Remove issue from sprint.
 # Open burndown report

h4. Expected Results

Removed issues appears on Burndown in the category of removed from Sprint
h3. Actual Results

Removed issues don't appear on the Burndown report information
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Burndown report doesn't reflect issues removed from Sprint of issues assigned to Epic

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Next-gen projects allow you to create as many issue types you can. *However*, if you have many issue types and try to create other columns (where Jira in the backend creates issue statuses in workflows) the procedure can break with an internal timeout *and* leave the workflow with non-existing breaking all the transitions from your project.

*In my tests this happened with 58 issue types, however this number can vary depending on performance factors*

h3. Environment
* *Happens only on next-gen projects*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a lot of issue types 
# Create a column in the next-gen board
# Delete that column

h3. Expected Results

* Delete the columns and don't break the workflows

h3. Actual Results

* When creating the column, if the performance threshold was reached, you'll see a generic error *and the column will be created*
**  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
* After *deleting the column* all the workflows will be broken and it won't be possible to transition issues in that project

h3. Workaround
None at the moment, in case we discover one we'll post it here
fields.summary: Having many issue types in the same next-gen project can break the workflows

fields.description: After closing a ticket, it goes to the bottom of the Kanban board. As a user, the ability to jump to the top of the kanban using a keyboard shortcut instead of scrolling would be helpful and save time.
fields.summary: Keyboard Shortcut to jump to top of Kanban board

fields.description:
Currently, if I am editing an issue's Description field and the contents are long enough to require a scrollbar, the formatting toolbar scrolls out of view at the top of the field.

Please make the formatting toolbar stick to the top of the text field so it is visible regardless of how long the field contents are.
fields.summary: Make the text format toolbar fixed so it stays visible when scrolled

fields.description:
As an Atlassian Community member

I want the community board to clearly indicate posters who are employees of Marketplace vendors

So I am better informed about the answers and advice provided

 

Acceptance criteria
 * Community members are required to self-identify when they are employed by a marketplace vendor in their profile
 * An icon and label are displayed next to all postings by community members to indicate when they are employed by a marketplace vendor
fields.summary: Add Marketplace indicator to community postings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Agile Wallboard Gadget doesn't show the parent issue in the first swimlane

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a board with Active Sprint in it
 # Create some issues with subtask and make sure they are part of Active Sprint
 # Configure the Swimlane so that it uses "Stories"
 # Create a dashboard and add Agile Wallboard gadget
 # Configure the gadget to select the board we created (don't select any Quick Filter) > Save

h3. Expected Results

The parent issue in the first Swimlane is shown.
h3. Actual Results

The parent issue in the first Swimlane isn't shown. 
 * !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Set the Swimlane to *None*
fields.summary: Agile Wallboard Gadget doesn't show the parent issue in the first swimlane

fields.description: We have a requirement to hide some of the category/sub category on JSD portal based on the user location. Can you please let us know how we can achieve this?
fields.summary: Hide / Show some of the category/sub category on JSD portal

fields.description: Currently, board admins can set "Non-Working Days" in the board setting. It would be really helpful if there also is an option to add temporary working days.
fields.summary: Ability to set temporary working days

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Transition fails when user's language is not English and the transition contains a rule to update a Time Stamp custom field.

h3. Environment
Jira Software + Next-gen

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a Time Stamp custom field to a Next-gen project
 # Add a rule to update the field during the transition
# Set the user profile to another language (e.g. Português (Brasil))
# Try moving an issue to the column where the  rule was added

h3. Expected Results
The transition is completed

h3. Actual Results
An error is displayed and the issue remains on the original column

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
Set the user's profile language to English (United States)
fields.summary: Transition fails when user's language is not English

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the endpoint *Create sprint* {code}POST /rest/agile/1.0/sprint{code} to create a sprint setting the start and end date, the sprint is correctly created on the UI, but the end date is not the same as the one set during the API request.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Get the board id where you want to create a sprint
 # Using the [Create sprint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/?_ga=2.46860450.442731297.1568670860-1847959900.1568670860#api-rest-agile-1-0-sprint-post] endpoint.
Examples: using cURL
{code}curl -D- -u <e-mail>:<token> -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"name": "TestingSprint","startDate": "2019-10-09T14:00:00.000Z","endDate": "2019-10-22T14:00:00.000Z","originBoardId": <board_id>,  "goal": "sprint goal"}' https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/sprint{code}

h3. Expected Results
When opening the sprint on the UI the end date is the same as the one on the request.
Response from the cURL:
{code}{
    "id": "<sprint-id>",
    "self": "https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/sprint/<sprint-id>",
    "state": "future",
    "name": "TestingSprint",
    "startDate": "2019-10-09T14:00:00.000Z",
    "endDate": "2019-10-22T14:00:00.000Z",
    "originBoardId": "<board_id>",
    "goal": "sprint goal"
}{code}

h3. Actual Results
The end date differs from the one set on the request.
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-10 at 12.08.33.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, the only workaround available is to edit the end date on the UI. We recommend informing the correct end date on the sprint goal until the bug is fixed.
fields.summary: Setting the end date when creating a sprint via the REST API doesn't reflect on the UI correctly

fields.description:
Hi!

I need that king of filter, but Jira cant do it:

resolutiondate > duedate

 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Filter resolutiondate > duedate

fields.description:
Hi!

Now we have 2 fields in the project options (project and category project). I need have a new one, because I want to difference the area (we have a lot of projects, and we need separate design, engineering, technology,... areas). Could it be possible?

Moreover, I need to filter by the area.

Instead of this, a solution could be filter by role (for instance area manager or project manager), but now we can´t filter that way (team manager = Bea, for example).

 

Thanks!
fields.summary: New project field

fields.description:
I have a lot of future features needed that are over six months in the future I don't want to assign to a particular quarter, I would like to prioritize them into a frozen column to the left that has no dates attached.  

This feature would help considerably as I have many features and enhancement requests that need a home until the highest priority moves into Discovery.
fields.summary: Add "Future" Column to Roadmap

fields.description:
When you are creating a search, if you type the initial letter from a user, you will see a pop-up suggesting you some names and if you click over any new user which has the accountID the JQL will use the accountID instead of the user name or display name. 
This is expected due to the GDPR. But, this is not user friendly because if we save the filter, the accountID will be there and other people will not know who is the user belonging the accountID.

We would like to improve the behavior on the filters in order to at least the filters show user's display names instead of accountID.
fields.summary: JQL filters display accountID

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Next-gen projects allow the creation of custom fields with the same name used as some system fields such as:

* *Linked Issues*
* *Issue Type*

When doing so, a generic error will be thrown in when creating new issue types. The issue type *will be created* but without any of the default fields.

h3. Environment
* Only affects *Next-gen* projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue type with one of the above names (i.e: "Issue Type")
# Try creating an issue-type in the same project

h3. Expected Results
* Issue-type is created or Jira blocks the usage of the system field name

h3. Actual Results
The Issue type is created without any field and the following error is thrown. 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
Despite the error, is still possible to use the NG issue type and add other fields.

h3. Notes
There may be *other names breaking* although we haven't received reports yet.

h3. Workaround
Change the name of the field to something different
fields.summary: Next-gen issue type creation throws error if there is a field with the same name as system fields

fields.description: For child issue, the quick filter should have all status to select. Currently, quick filter works with only done status.
fields.summary: For child issue, quick filter should have all status from workflow to select.
Sprint field could be present in a cleaner format

fields.description: Creator of next-gen project is prominently displayed as project lead in project overview. This is misleading. We would like to be able to change the lead for a next-gen project or at least suppress this role being displayed in the project overview screen.
fields.summary: Change "Lead" on Next-gen Projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Deleting the last column of the Scrum Next-Gen board causes the Sprint Burndown to not load anymore.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Video reproducing the bug: [https://cl.ly/9df7f2f48fc0]
h3. Expected Results

The Report should start to consider the last column of the board as the new resolution column for the report.
h3. Actual Results

The report does not load and give an error
 _There was an error while fetching your report.
 _
h3. Workaround
 # Close the sprint
 # Update statuses for issues that were in the deleted column
 # Open a new sprint
fields.summary: Deleting ta column of the Scrum Next-Gen board that contain an issue causes the Sprint Burndown to not load anymore

fields.description:
'Hide completed issues' field in Kanban board settings is a server only feature, but it would be good to have it for Cloud also. For Server it is described in [Configuring filters|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/configuring-filters-938845268.html].

Related suggestion for Next-gen projects: [JSWCLOUD\-17257: Next\-gen project backlog \- filter for completed issues.|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-17257]
fields.summary: Feature request: 'Hide completed issues' in Kanban board settings

fields.description:
JQL function "*parentEpic*" does not work with team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects, "*parent*" should be used instead. However, there is a significant difference between those functions: "parentEpic" shows the full tree under an epic (including the epic itself in addition to issues down to sub-task of a story of an epic), but "parent" shows only the direct child issues of an epic.

It would be good to have the functionality of parentEpic in team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects.
fields.summary: Show full tree under an epic in JQL does not work with team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects; company-managed (formerly classic) had parentEpic

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently it is not possible to have a Reporting for Multiple Sprints at once. 

h3. Why it is Important
In an organization where we work in multiple teams  and we would like to have a standardized reporting of the progress of our Sprints simultaneously for our Internal reports. It would be beneficial, if we could be able to add different Sprints value to the same issues, so at the end of the day, the Sprint report can be able to show us an equivalent reporting for both separate Sprint at once.
fields.summary: Ability to Allow Multiple Sprint Value on a Single issue for dual reporting

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Navigation to a backlog URL such as */jira/software/projects/*/boards/*/backlog displays an empty page if backlog feature is disabled.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project
 # Enable backlog feature
 # Navigate to backlog
 # Copy the url
 # Disable backlog feature
 # Navigate to the copied URL

h3. Expected Results

If backlog feature is disabled, upon hitting a backlog URL users should be redirected to board or a message informing that the backlog is not enabled should be displayed rather than an empty page.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Navigation to backlog URL when backlog feature is disabled displays an empty page

fields.description: We have the option to move stories to next sprint or top/bottom of backlog, but when I move a story to next sprint, I may also want the stories to be at the top or bottom of said sprint.
fields.summary: Right Click Option to Move JIRA ticket to "Top of Sprint"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud, a _next-gen_ project with Backlog

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable sprints in the next-gen project
# Create an issue in the backlog
# Resolve the issue. Keep it in the backlog
# Refresh the page. The issue is no longer shown in the backlog section
# Disable the sprints functionality
# Look at the backlog. The resolved issue appears there and is striked through

h3. Expected Results
Resolved issue does not appear, no matter if sprints are enabled or not

h3. Actual Results
If sprints are disabled, the resolved issues appear

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Resolved issues still appear in the next-gen backlog when sprints feature is turned off

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sprint Burndown report - Issues completed outside of sprint is returning invalid query

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a burndown report
 # Click on Issues completed outside of sprint link

h3. Expected Results

Get a list of issues completed outside sprint
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
''Error in JQL Query: Expecting either a value, list or function but got ')'. You must surround ')' in quotation marks to use it as a value. (line 1, character 14)''...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sprint Burndown report - Issues completed outside of sprint is returning invalid query

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like that inside the Epic it defaults to display only open issues and have an option to display completed issues.

Right now, it displays the entire list of issues, completed and non-completed. There are cases where this list gets very long and cause delays to load the entire page so I can filter the issues that are done.

It would be great if it defaults to display only non-completed issues and give the option to display the completed one through the check-box.

Currently, it loads everything and I have to wait to load the page so I can filter to hide the completed issues:

 !Screen Shot 2020-03-05 at 16.25.30.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like that inside the Epic it defaults to display only open issues and have an option to display completed issues.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the "Watchers" field isn't visible in the issue creation form of the next-gen projects. This prevents users to add watchers in the issue creation moment.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the possibility to see the "Watchers" field in the issue creation form of next-gen projects.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to add watchers during the issue creation in next-gen projects

fields.description:
Currently, only next-gen project administrators can add or remove watchers to issues. Users members of the "Member" project role can only add or remove themselves as watchers.

As a next-gen user, I want to be able to add or remove different users as watchers to issues
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to add or remove watchers to issues

fields.description:
In Jira Software Cloud, anyone with Administer Jira permissions can create classic or next-gen projects. 

It would be nice to have a setting that allows users to only create next-gen projects, not classic, or more granular global permissions that restrict the type of projects users can create.

Potential relation to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-17242.
fields.summary: Permission to restrict creating new projects to only next-gen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, the access level of next-gen projects cannot be defaulted to a specific value ("Open", "Limited" or "Private"). Users and admins can set this configuration on project's creation, however.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Jira admins to set a default access level for Next-gen projects.

h3. Why this is important
This should make the administrative task of managing Next-gen permissions easier.

h3. Workaround 
Users and admins can set this configuration on project's creation.
fields.summary: As an admin, I'd like to set the default access level for all Next-gen projects

fields.description:
As a Jira Cloud user

I want filter query language (JQL) to include missing, common SQL features

So my company has access to our valuable data without the need to buy marketplace add-ons for features missing from Jira.

 

Acceptance criteria:
 * SQL features of JQL match the most recent ISO SQL standard, where possible and performant
 * Regular releases update JQL as the ISO SQL standard evolves
 * Features are part of native Jira Cloud, not provided at additional cost

 

Business case:

Jira Cloud can help teams with basic, work management.  For real-world production of enterprise products, teams need access to all of the valuable information which is available in the Jira issues and their logs.  While native reporting capabilities are limited, enhanced JQL would allow teams to create filters using current reporting to make their valuable data visible.  This enhancement would make Jira's products a more viable alternative to competitor work management tools.
fields.summary: Add missing, SQL features to filters

fields.description:
In a scrum backlog, the story points appear in a badge to the right.

Unfortunately, that is not an option in the kanban backlog.  The workaround is to add the story points on a second row via the issue layout.  This means that fewer issues fit on the screen at one time, meaning that it's more difficult to navigate the backlog and to interact with it.

Could you please add the story point badges in to the KanPlan view? !image-2019-10-03-19-39-08-251.png!
fields.summary: please include the story points in a badge on the kanban backlog

fields.description:
*Background/Rationale*

Quick filters are very helpful.  We use them extensively to help slice&dice the backlog into different views for different purposes.  As we do this, though, the list of epics in the Epics panel remains the same.  

When I use a quick filter, I do so because I want to focus on something (or to help the product owner focus on something).  For example, one of the quick filters relates to a particular component.  Not all of the epics are relevant to that component.  This means that we are sorting through (i.e., distracted by) epics that aren't relevant.  It creates mental clutter, if you will.  

Similarly, it is difficult to assign issues to epics, because the epics are ordered by priority rather than component-proximity.  This requires much scrolling of the Epics panel, which adds friction.

*Suggestion*

It would be lovely if there were an option (maybe something akin to "Create epic"? instead of???) to apply a quick filters to both the individual issues in the backlog *and* the list in the Epics panel.
fields.summary: quick filters on the backlog to apply to the Epics panel as well as the issues

fields.description:
Right now, when we perform a bulk edit operation, we can only clear or replace the existing value for the sprint field, if there are multiple sprints, we can't select one single sprint to be removed.

Please improve the bulk edit operation to let users remove one single sprint via bulk edit operation without having to replace all existing value for the field.
fields.summary: Ability to mass remove specific sprint via bulk edit.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to drag and drop issues in the Next-Gen backlog, either to reorder issues or to assign them to Sprints, an error is thrown in the console.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 

# Try to drag and drop an issue in the Next-Gen board.

h3. Expected Results

The issue is added to the Sprint or is placed in the desired position in the Backlog.

h3. Actual Results

The following error is thrown in the backlog:
{code}VM55 vendor.f5cb76eaed1af557409c.7.js:1 Uncaught TypeError: n.push is not a function
    at Object.onDragEnd (async-software-backlog-page.778c4c871ceaa92b5520.7.js:1)
    at n.onDragEnd (async-software-backlog-page.778c4c871ceaa92b5520.7.js:1)
    at Jt (jira-spa.f2f6c2c89d6045163f7b.7.js:1)
    at jira-spa.f2f6c2c89d6045163f7b.7.js:1
    at Gt (jira-spa.f2f6c2c89d6045163f7b.7.js:1)
    at Object.o [as drop] (jira-spa.f2f6c2c89d6045163f7b.7.js:1)
    at jira-spa.f2f6c2c89d6045163f7b.7.js:1
    at jira-spa.f2f6c2c89d6045163f7b.7.js:1
    at jira-spa.f2f6c2c89d6045163f7b.7.js:1
    at jira-spa.f2f6c2c89d6045163f7b.7.js:1{code}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Drag and Drop not working in Next-Gen backlog

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After deleting Card Colors priorities and then refreshing the page, priorities automatically reinstated.
The documentation is unclear, leads to believe that you can delete as long as you don’t have any issues matching it.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to the card colors setting in the configuration page for a classic board
# Select Priorities on the Colors based option
# Delete one of the priorities
# Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results
It is expected that the priority disappears 

h3. Actual Results
After refreshing the page, deleted priorities appear again.

h3. Notes
[The documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/customizing-cards-764478020.html#Customizingcards-coloursConfiguringcardcolors] says:
{quote}
Delete a card color— Click Delete. This effectively resets the card to the default color. If you still have issues matching that card type, refresh the screen to reset the deleted card color to the default color).
{quote}
However even if you don’t have issue it is still not deleted.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no workaround.
fields.summary: Card colors reappearing after being deleted

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When using the Burndown Chart with *Remaining Estimate* when logging the work in the new issue view, the Remaining Estimation is reduced by the amount of work logged but the total Time Spent is displayed as 0.

h3. Steps to reproduce

* Create a board and set the Estimation Settings to Original Time Estimate and select the Time Spent and Remaining Time Estimate option.
* Create a Sprint and add some estimated issues in it;
* Start the Sprint;
* Log time using the new issue view;
* Check the logged time in the Burndown Chart.

h3. Expected outcome

Both Time Spent and Remaining Time would be updated.

h3. Actual outcome

Only the Remaining Time receives the value correctly while the Time Spent remains as 0.

h3. Workaround

Use the old issue view to log work.
fields.summary: Burndown Chart does not consider Time Spent when logging Time in the New Issue View

fields.description:
We have a number of dashboards which are used to track progress of issues across multiple versions of our product.  
Each dashboard uses the same set of gadgets but points to specific filters for a particular release.
When setting up a new release, we would expect to just copy an existing dashboard and point each gadget to the relevant filters.
However, we are finding that when we point a "Filter Count" gadget to a new filter, all of the Counts fields are delted and must be recreated from scratch every time.  This places a large overhead on the creation of new dashboard.
fields.summary: As a Team Leader, I want to be able to copy a Dashboard and update filters without having to recreate all Count fields in Filter Count gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users that don't have Browse Users and Group permission cannot load the Roadmap page in Next-Gen projects.
At the Kanban or Scrum board, an error is displayed at the console that you don't have Browse Users and Groups permission but the board loads with no issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Next-Gen project
# Enable Roadmaps
# Remove the permission to Browse Users and Groups from Global Permission

h3. Expected Results
The Roadmap should still open

h3. Actual Results
Somehow, the permission to Browse Users and Groups is linked to Next-Gen projects board that make the Roadmap page not load if you don't have this permission

h3. Workaround
Grant the Browse Users and Group permission at the Global Permissions and the Roadmap will run.
fields.summary: Users that don't have Browse Users and Group permission cannot load the Roadmap page in Next-Gen projects

fields.description:
Currently, the Control Chart report dates and times are based on the timezone of the device used to access the report, while other parts of Jira (the issues' history, for example) use the timezone defined in Jira general settings.

If the device uses a different timezone than defined in Jira, it's hard to compare the report results with JQL searches.

Considering this, as a Jira Software user, I want the Control Chart to use the timezone configuration defined in Jira.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want the Control Chart to use the timezone configuration defined in Jira

fields.description: My team (not developers) often has tasks that are split among multiple people. In Classic, we would split tasks and assign them to different members (or split a single task into work across multiple sprints). We really miss this feature in Next Gen
fields.summary: Clone into multiple copies or "Split"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In a Kanban board, you can select multiple issues at the same time, and move them all to another column (transition).

The same is true for Sub-tasks, but you cannot select Sub-tasks across different parents:  [^Selecting multiple Sub-tasks.mp4].

That may require extra work, specially in cases where there are only Sub-tasks in the board.

h3. Suggestion

Allow the possibility of selecting Sub-tasks across different parents, and move them to another column within the board.
fields.summary: Ability to select multiple Sub-tasks across different parents in a board

fields.description:
As a Jira Software user, I would like to have the ability to remove completed sprints from issues without having to reopen the sprint.

By reopening the sprint, the sprint completion data is changed, it affects all reports, it is not the desired behavior.

As a workaround, we were able to remove completed sprints from issues via bulk change, however, this workaround is no longer working as reported in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-17215
fields.summary: Allow users to remove closed sprints from issues.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When doing a basic search specifically for the Next-Gen project, the status doesn't show for the Next-Gen Project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Next-Gen project with statues from the board
 # Let say "To Do", "Progress" and "Done"
 # Accessing the filter and specific the Next-Gen project
 # Clicking on the status and noticed that nothing is populated from the status filter.

h3. Expected Results
Status filter shows all the statues for the Next-Gen project

h3. Actual Results

No result populated from the Next-Gen project.

h3. Workaround

Switch to JQL and use the Advance search for the Next-Gen project.
fields.summary: Not able to see status from the basic search for Next-Gen Project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using subtasks in a team-managed (formerly next-gen) project, those won't appear in the project issue when using the 'sprint in openSprints()' JQL operation.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a team-managed (formerly next-gen) project
 # Create a few issues with subtasks in the project
 # Go to the issue list view (PIN) and use the 'sprint in openSprints()' JQL operation

h3. Expected Results

Subtasks should show in the list of issues.
h3. Actual Results

Subtasks are not appearing in the list.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using the JQL sprint in openSprints() doesn't include team-managed (formerly next-gen) subtasks
Ability to move the ticket to board after changing the status.

fields.description:
[https://twitter.com/longseespace/statuses/1178218358862311426]

Please provide an option to hide the header/top filter from next-gen projects to reclaim screen real estate.
fields.summary: Option to hide header/top filter

fields.description:
Hi There I have been looking around on your forums and I have noticed on server and Jira Data Center but you do not have this in Jira cloud now this is very very bad as you don't allow us to export just one project on cloud either so you are really limiting what we can do with this issue the only option i have is to create a project with restricted access to only certains users (which is not ideal at all)

 

when i asked the community i had a Jira community leader suggest to delete the data. i don't need to say more other then no company ever deleted data that they just want hidden from everyday viewing.

 

this function has been asked for over 16 years now you have it in 2/3 of your products it is the most basic feature we are asking for if you don't allow us the option the export single project then we need the option to archive a project Atlassian earns a ridiclous amount each year and basic core functionaility is still held back please sort out this issue by ethier allowing export of individual project and import of individual projects or/and allow cloud to archive projects as deleting data is a huge no in any company i know for a fact you will have not deleted your data from 16 years ago you will have that stuff archived (yet don't give us the option to do so)
fields.summary: Ability Archiving a project in JIRA Cloud

fields.description: I want to be able to assign an epic when creating an issue on next-gen projects but its not there
fields.summary: There is no field for epic when creating next gen issues

fields.description: We can use the Ctrl button to select several tasks on the board at once in order to apply batch actions to them. However, if more than one task is selected, then when we try to move the selected tasks with the mouse, we are able to move only one task, but not all selected ones. This creates inconvenience in the case when you need to change priorities in development, for example, move tasks from one epic over tasks in another epic.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to move several highlighted tasks on the board at once in order to quickly change priorities

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On reports, the creation date of an issue (or the date when the issue was added to sprint)  is overridden by its parent's creation date

h3. Environment
Jira Software + Next-gen

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a next-gen scrum project.
 # Create an issue.
 # Create a sprint, add issue to sprint, then start sprint.
 # Now open the burnup report.
 # Create an epic, assign issue to the epic.
 # Now open the burnup report again. There'd be an "Added to sprint" entry.

h3. Expected Results
The report reads the issue's created date.

h3. Actual Results
The report reads the parent issue's created date.

h3. Notes
NA

h3. Workaround
NA
fields.summary: On reports, the creation date of an issue is overridden by its parent's creation date

fields.description:
Currently it's possible to clone team-managed issues, but we'd like the ability to Split issues as in company-managed Jira Cloud projects:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/creating-issues-and-sub-tasks-764478439.html]
fields.summary: Ability to split team-managed issues

fields.description:
I've tried to screenshot and explain what I mean by this. The newer popup for profiles feels like it's getting in my way and being more annoying than I ever remember it being.

I think it's way too big for what it actually needs to show me (if anything! If there's such little detail, why even show it?). It also pops up straight away even when not needed. I'd expect that I'd have to hover over a profile link for a little longer than normal, just to get more detail. 

!image-2019-09-26-10-07-01-456.png!
fields.summary: Profile Popup is too large and intrusive

fields.description:
I want to fill the sprint and story point estimate directly on Freshdesk, the Freshdesk support says that this function on Atlassian Jira Plus app it is not implemented.

One way that i could bypass this is create custom fields and link them to the original fields, there is a way to do that?

Another thing to do is send all the issues created from Freshdesk the current sprint or a default sprint, but all of them go to backlog.

 

Somebody could help me with that or even implement this functions?


Thanks.
fields.summary: Freshdesk tickets to a sprint, not backlog

fields.description:
Hi,

I just wanted to say that when I am using JIRA, I am not texting friends or writting a facebook status. I am defining development specification that include a lots of bullet points and ":"

 

example:

label FR : ...

label EN : ...

!image-2019-09-25-10-59-13-217.png!

Being spammed with emoticon suggestions each time I use ":" is very annoying. Furthermore, I have a bunch of tickets where the ":" had to be without a space that now display emoticon.

!image-2019-09-25-10-57-37-842.png!

 

Can you just remove that feature?

It just fucked my product backlog.
fields.summary: rollback emoticon in description editor

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1) Enter all the required details to create a ticket.

2) Attach a file.

3) While file upload is in progress click on the "Create" button. Confirm a message appears "Upload is in progress".

4) Once media upload is completed try to click on the "Create" button again.

5) Observed that the ticket is not created and the message still appears "upload is in progress" even after media is upload successfully
fields.summary: Not able to create a ticket after clicking on "create".

fields.description:
Feature Request: make possible to select the default value for Update Parent Issue action, when all Sub-Task are Done

In my current Jira Cloud workflow, I have 2 final states for Story/Bugs: "Discarded" and "Done".
I would like to have the chance to set the default value among those two for the "Update Parent Issue" action, triggered when all Sub-Tasks are set to Done.

Currently, the default value is "{color:#ff8b00}_Discarded_{color}", but it's not really convenient, since in almost all cases when the Sub-Tasks are set to Done, the natural and correct Parent Issue Update should set the parent Story/Bug to "{color:#00875a}_Done_{color}".

This change request aims to address the present annoying operation to manually change every time the parent status transition, by being able to define a default value (in my case "Done").

Eventually, as temporary workaround, could you please investigate if the present default value is determined by the status IDs?
In my Project I have the following:
- Done ➟ ID = 10002
- Discarded ➟ ID = 10802
Meaning: is the present default value set to the first final status, ordered by ID DESC?

Please refer to attached screenshot.

!https://tnckb94959.i.lithium.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/66307i7B62F960E1F55F0F/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!
fields.summary: Feature Request: make possible to select the default value for Update Parent Issue action, when all Sub-Task are Done
